attributes.action: There should be a cap on houses prices that are unliveable.
attributes.additional_details:
Cap house prices on houses that are unliveable. Houses that are 
a) covered in mould, 
b) do not have the basics such as a toilet or a functioning kitchen  

Should not be able to sell for high prices E.g over £300k
attributes.background: There are so many houses that are unliveable, such as full of mould, no bathroom or kitchen trying to sell for high prices such as £500,000. There should be a cap on houses that fall into this category. People shouldn’t have to buy a house for £500k and then spend over £200k fixing it up.

rejection.details: The price of homes are a matter for sellers and buyers, not the Government or Parliament.
